notes_display: Analysis by A.A. Gordus, University of Michigan 1974, by Neutron activation of streak; Rev. slightly double strike and blind spot
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Kawad I on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with two mural elements, crescent above forehead, above covered korymbos; between crown cap and crescent ribbed ribbons pointing upwards, double pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing to the left and right behind the shoulders; pointing upwards; earing consisting of three elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; crescent on both shoulders; double row of pearls running from the shoulders to the breast (varying decoration, see below); star in left and right upper fields; crescent and star at 3 h, 6 h, 9 h, rigged border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 2 h l.i. kw't 'pzwn’| kawād abzōn| "Kawad, increase"; illegible
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of three elements; round altar shaft; to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, three altar slabs; altar flames rendered in four tiers of four, three, two and one strokes respectively; star to the left of altar flames, crescent to the right; to the left and the right of altar attendant with stylized crown of Kawad I, right hand raised, both figures facing inwards; 	 Kw’t at 9 h; ridged border
